designScenario.description: The Protection System is a comprehensive security framework for passenger airplanes aimed at detecting, preventing, and mitigating unauthorized access, sabotage, and potential external threats. This system integrates advanced sensor technologies, biometric access control, and real-time threat analysis, ensuring immediate activation of emergency protocols and secure communication between flight deck, maintenance, and ground control. Leveraging redundant modules and robust cyber-security measures, the system is engineered following stringent airplane engineering standards and safety regulations.
designScenario.name: Protection System

details.description: Continuously monitor environmental conditions and detect unauthorized access or suspicious activities using multiple sensor arrays.
Automatically trigger alerts and lock-down protocols upon detection of security breaches.
Ensure threat detection and alert generation within 3 seconds of anomaly detection.
Process sensor data from multiple modules concurrently with minimal latency.
Maintain system integrity under component failures by activating redundant modules automatically.
Integrate fail-safe mechanisms to isolate compromised modules and prevent cascading failures.
Provide secure, intuitive interfaces for flight crew and security personnel featuring real-time status updates.
Ensure the system is maintainable through regular self-diagnostics, remote firmware updates, and cybersecurity patches.

relationships.description: The Threat Detection Unit aggregates input data from the Security Surveillance Module sensors to monitor for potential security breaches.
The Emergency Response Coordination Module is associated with the Threat Detection Unit, facilitating immediate alert dissemination and command actions.
The Access Control Module depends on data from the Threat Detection Unit to authorize or deny access in real-time, ensuring system integrity.
The Power Backup Module is composed of dedicated Battery Module and Dual Power Module to ensure continuous operation of the Protection System.
